publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4825 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Action on Darfur—That the Parliament notes Amnesty International’s reports during 2006 of the gross human rights abuses committed in Darfur and believes that pressure should be put on the Sudanese Government to protect the people of Darfur and ensure that their human rights are respected, to facilitate the immediate and unhindered delivery of humanitarian assistance and to bring to justice those responsible for committing human rights abuses.

S2M-4825 Action on Darfur (lodged on 20 September 2006) Tommy Sheridan*, Bill Butler*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*, Trish Godman*, Frances Curran*, Rosie Kane*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Sandra White*, Richard Lochhead*, Campbell Martin*

S2M-4825 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Action on Darfur—That the Parliament notes Amnesty International’s reports during 2006 of the gross human rights abuses committed in Darfur and believes that pressure should be put on the Sudanese Government to protect the people of Darfur and ensure that their human rights are respected, to facilitate the immediate and unhindered delivery of humanitarian assistance and to bring to justice those responsible for committing human rights abuses. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Bill Butler, Roseanna Cunningham, Christine Grahame, Fiona Hyslop, Trish Godman, Frances Curran, Rosie Kane, Patrick Harvie, Ms Sandra White, Richard Lochhead, Campbell Martin, Chris Ballance*, Des McNulty*
S2M-4825 Action on Darfur (lodged on 20 September 2006) Scott Barrie*
S2M-4825 Action on Darfur (lodged on 20 September 2006) Shiona Baird*
S2M-4825 Action on Darfur (lodged on 20 September 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4825 Action on Darfur (lodged on 20 September 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-4825 Action on Darfur (lodged on 20 September 2006) Alasdair Morgan*
